H0.text: Epiphytes are plants that grow on other plants.

H1.text: Fungi are plants that grow on other plants.

H2.text: Parasites are plants that grow on other plants.

H3.text: Bryophytes are plants that grow on other plants.

A4.text: An epiphyte (from Ancient Greek epi-, meaning 'upon', and phut√≥n, meaning 'plant') is a plant or plant-like organism that grows on the surface of another plant or plant-like organism such as kelp.

A5.text: Epiphytes are usually found in the temperate zone (e.g., many mosses, liverworts, lichens, and algae)
